text: Hi folks! I have a problem where my debuger in VSCode won't stop on breakpoints that i have made. I want to debug some errors originating from a library I'm using, and this would be much easier if the debugger would cooperate. Have anybody had the same issue before?

elements.text: Hi folks! I have a problem where my debuger in VSCode won't stop on breakpoints that i have made. I want to debug some errors originating from a library I'm using, and this would be much easier if the debugger would cooperate. Have anybody had the same issue before?

text: Are you running it in compiled mode or normal one? Does it terminate but not on breakpoints or does it run forever?

elements.text: Are you running it in compiled mode or normal one? Does it terminate but not on breakpoints or does it run forever?

text: I have tried both. When running in compiled mode the debugger runs through the program and throws an error and stops from the exact line where I have put the breakpoint, as if it wasn't there. When running in non-compiled mode the debugger just takes forever and doesn't produce any output

elements.text: I have tried both. When running in compiled mode the debugger runs through the program and throws an error and stops from the exact line where I have put the breakpoint, as if it wasn't there. When running in non-compiled mode the debugger just takes forever and doesn't produce any output

text: Yeah that's what I expected. You might be interested in Infiltrator.jl and you might want to read my post <https://opensourc.es/blog/basics-debugging/|https://opensourc.es/blog/basics-debugging/>

attachments.title: Debugging in Julia - Two different ways
attachments.text: Different ways of debug julia code without using println.
attachments.fallback: Debugging in Julia - Two different ways

elements.text: Yeah that's what I expected. You might be interested in Infiltrator.jl and you might want to read my post

text: Thanks! :raised_hands: Will read it and tell if I have any questions

text: Good blog post! Infiltrator on the way

text: Thanks. Yeah still hoping the normal way of debugging will get better :smile:
